jinja2.tests

Built-in template tests used with the is operator.

Attributes

TESTS

Functions

test_odd(→ bool)

Return true if the variable is odd.

test_even(→ bool)

Return true if the variable is even.

test_divisibleby(→ bool)

Check if a variable is divisible by a number.

test_defined(→ bool)

Return true if the variable is defined:

test_undefined(→ bool)

Like defined() but the other way round.

test_filter(→ bool)

Check if a filter exists by name. Useful if a filter may be

test_test(→ bool)

Check if a test exists by name. Useful if a test may be

test_none(→ bool)

Return true if the variable is none.

test_boolean(→ bool)

Return true if the object is a boolean value.

test_false(→ bool)

Return true if the object is False.

test_true(→ bool)

Return true if the object is True.

test_integer(→ bool)

Return true if the object is an integer.

test_float(→ bool)

Return true if the object is a float.

test_lower(→ bool)

Return true if the variable is lowercased.

test_upper(→ bool)

Return true if the variable is uppercased.

test_string(→ bool)

Return true if the object is a string.

test_mapping(→ bool)

Return true if the object is a mapping (dict etc.).

test_number(→ bool)

Return true if the variable is a number.

test_sequence(→ bool)

Return true if the variable is a sequence. Sequences are variables

Check if an object points to the same memory address than another

test_iterable(→ bool)

Check if it's possible to iterate over an object.

test_escaped(→ bool)

Check if the value is escaped.

test_in(→ bool)

Check if value is in seq.

Module Contents

jinja2.tests.test_odd(value: int) → bool[source]

Return true if the variable is odd.

jinja2.tests.test_even(value: int) → bool[source]

Return true if the variable is even.

jinja2.tests.test_divisibleby(value: int, num: int) → bool[source]

Check if a variable is divisible by a number.

jinja2.tests.test_defined(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the variable is defined:

{% if variable is defined %}
    value of variable: {{ variable }}
{% else %}
    variable is not defined
{% endif %}

See the default() filter for a simple way to set undefined variables.

jinja2.tests.test_undefined(value: Any) → bool[source]

Like defined() but the other way round.

jinja2.tests.test_filter(env: jinja2.environment.Environment, value: str) → bool[source]

Check if a filter exists by name. Useful if a filter may be optionally available.

{% if 'markdown' is filter %}
    {{ value | markdown }}
{% else %}
    {{ value }}
{% endif %}

Added in version 3.0.

jinja2.tests.test_test(env: jinja2.environment.Environment, value: str) → bool[source]

Check if a test exists by name. Useful if a test may be optionally available.

{% if 'loud' is test %}
    {% if value is loud %}
        {{ value|upper }}
    {% else %}
        {{ value|lower }}
    {% endif %}
{% else %}
    {{ value }}
{% endif %}

Added in version 3.0.

jinja2.tests.test_none(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the variable is none.

jinja2.tests.test_boolean(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the object is a boolean value.

Added in version 2.11.

jinja2.tests.test_false(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the object is False.

Added in version 2.11.

jinja2.tests.test_true(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the object is True.

Added in version 2.11.

jinja2.tests.test_integer(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the object is an integer.

Added in version 2.11.

jinja2.tests.test_float(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the object is a float.

Added in version 2.11.

jinja2.tests.test_lower(value: str) → bool[source]

Return true if the variable is lowercased.

jinja2.tests.test_upper(value: str) → bool[source]

Return true if the variable is uppercased.

jinja2.tests.test_string(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the object is a string.

jinja2.tests.test_mapping(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the object is a mapping (dict etc.).

Added in version 2.6.

jinja2.tests.test_number(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the variable is a number.

jinja2.tests.test_sequence(value: Any) → bool[source]

Return true if the variable is a sequence. Sequences are variables that are iterable.

jinja2.tests.test_sameas(value: Any, other: Any) → bool[source]

Check if an object points to the same memory address than another object:

{% if foo.attribute is sameas false %}
    the foo attribute really is the `False` singleton
{% endif %}
jinja2.tests.test_iterable(value: Any) → bool[source]

Check if it’s possible to iterate over an object.

jinja2.tests.test_escaped(value: Any) → bool[source]

Check if the value is escaped.

jinja2.tests.test_in(value: Any, seq: Container[Any]) → bool[source]

Check if value is in seq.

Added in version 2.10.
